alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; Greensville; Mecklenburg (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 2:49PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Northampton, southwestern Greensville, southeastern Mecklenburg and southern Brunswick Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 248 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ebony to Norlina to near Hillsborough. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Brunswick, Gaston, La Crosse, Barley, Gasburg, Ebony, Gum Forks, Triplet, Bowens Corner, Henrico, White Plains, Vultare, Valentines, Slates Corner, Bracey, Roanoke Rapids Lake, Turners Crossroads, Palmer Springs and Lake Gaston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for northeastern North Carolina...and south central and southeastern Virginia.
